Qn: What is the difference between an abstract class and a base class in inheritance?
A: They are the same, just different names.
B: Both can be inherited to derive child class.
C: Both can be instantiated to create objects of the class.
D: Base classes can store states but abstract classes cannot.

Qn: Which of the following statements about abstract class is true?
A: The members (properties and methods) of an abstract class must be abstract too.
B: Abstract methods in an abstract class may not be overridden in its subclasses.
D: Keyword "open" is not allowed to use inside an abstract class.
